main event: A bright orange light was sighted in the sky over Aiken, South Carolina on December 29, 1967.
interesting points: The object appeared to be round and larger than a star, pulsating and changing color from orange to red.
The object was observed for about 6 minutes, suddenly disappearing while still at 30 degrees elevation in the eastern sky.
The observer claimed to have taken photographs of the object, but they were not received.
Police officers D.T. Marchant and Max A. Meek also saw the object and tried to get closer to it, but it quickly went straight up and disappeared without making any noise.
The Air Force requested additional information and photographs from the witness several times, but did not receive a response until over a year later.
sighted object: a bright orange light in the sky
witnesses: civilian observer, Sgt. Max A. Meek (police officer), Officer D.T. Marchant (police officer)
photographs: claimed to be taken, but not received
